description: Remainder when the larger of n and its reverse is divided by the smaller.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,1000
mathematica: l := {} For[i = 1, i < 100, i++, x := FromDigits[Reverse[IntegerDigits[i]]]; If[x >= i, AppendTo[l, Mod[x, i]], AppendTo[l, Mod[i, x]]]] l - _Jake Foster_, Jun 05 2008rln[n_]:=Module[{r=IntegerReverse[n]},If[r>n,Mod[r,n],Mod[n,r]]]; Join[ {0}, Array[rln,90]] (* The program uses the IntegerReverse function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 03 2016 *)
prog: (PARI) { for (n=0, 1000, x=n; r=0; while (x>0, d=x-10*(x\10); x\=10; r=r*10 + d); p=max(n, r); q=min(n, r); write("b061467.txt", n, " ", p%q) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 23 2009](Haskell)a061467 0 = 0a061467 n = mod (max n n') (min n n') where n' = a004086 n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 31 2013
author: _Erich Friedman_, Jun 16 2001
